<mxGraphModel><root><Graph href="http://www.mxgraph.com/" label="Graph" id="0"><mxCell /></Graph><Layer label="Default Layer" spID="82" spGuid="" id="1" spId=""><mxCell parent="0"><mxRectangle width="2460" as="geometry" height="1380" /></mxCell></Layer><Role href="https://gavinet.sharepoint.com/sites/km/pmt/Lists/Core%20Processes/DispForm.aspx?pmtID=409" label="Country" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33805" spID="409" spParentIDs="81,82" spDescription="" spParentGuid="" id="4"><mxCell style="swimlane" vertex="1" parent="1"><mxGeometry width="2380" as="geometry" height="170" /></mxCell></Role><Output href="" label="Pre-October HLRP Information Letter" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33801" spID="1782" spParentIDs="82" spDescription="<p>Given Unicef Supply Division procurement requirements, all vaccine columes are to be finalised by 30 September in order to meet following-year stock requirements. Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).</p>

spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spID="1781" spParentIDs="82" spDescription="<p>Given Unicef Supply Division procurement requirements, all vaccine columes are to be finalised by 30 September in order to meet following-year stock requirements. Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).</p>

Title: TBC: Respond to request for clarification
ProcessItemDescription:
Given that Comments (formerly referred to as 'Clarifications') are not captured in the IRC, is not clear how this step relates to the HLRP process (unlike the IRC, which does capture 'Comments', which are documented as Issues to Be Addressed).
In ad

Title: TBC: Prepare Information Letter, if clarification needed
ProcessItemDescription: Please see TBC: Clarification required decision content

Title: TBC: Prepare Approval Request (AR) and submit to Finance
ProcessItemDescription: The role of the SCM is not clearly outlined in the HLRP AR and DL creation processes. Further validation required from IM&QA and Country Support

Title: TBC: Draft Decision Letter and Management Letter
ProcessItemDescription: It is not clear how the Record of Proceedings from the HLRP informs the production of the DL or Management Letter as there are no Country-level 'strengthening actions' in the Record and, therefore, there areno definitiveinputs from the HLRP into DLs or Management Letters.

<p>WHO defines six building blocks that contribute to a strengthened health system:</p>

<ul>
 <li><strong>Health service delivery:</strong>&nbsp;a network of integrated and people-centred health facilities to provide access to primary and secondary care;</li>
 <li><strong>Health workers</strong>, in the right place, at the right time with training, experience and incentives;</li>
 <li><strong>Logistics and supply systems,</strong>&nbsp;including an adequate cold chain in place to deliver vaccines;</li>
 <li><strong>Health financing</strong>&nbsp;to raise sufficient funds for health and improve financial risk protection;</li>
 <li><strong>Health information and monitoring</strong>&nbsp;to generate quality data and to measure what is being done and achieved;</li>
 <li><strong>Leadership and governance</strong>&nbsp;to ensure that a strategic policy framework exists and there is proper accountability and oversight.</li>
</ul>

Title: Request sign-off from Director of Country Support
ProcessItemDescription: Open question raised with Business on whether it makes sense to formally engage corresponding Country Support Regional Head rather than having the SCM request formal sign-off from the Director of Country Support, given the current reporting structures and accountabilities

Title: Finalise Comment Tracker updates and Resolution date
Engage with outsourced Translation provider for non-Anglophone Country reports
Prepare Decision Letter (DL)
ProcessItemDescription: The DL is prepared using source data from the VI Tracker & a Finance Access database as well as a Word-based template that 'pulls' data from these sources to pre-populate the Word document. Based on the review</p>

<ol>
 <li>Reject;</li>
 <li>Ask for clarifications; or</li>
 <li>Approve</li>
</ol>

<p>Please note: Country Responsible Officer (CRO) is a term long replaced by Senior Country Manager (SCM). Please replace any and all instance of CRO with SCM.</p>

<p>Understood as Step&nbsp;2 (S2). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.</p>

<p>Cash Disbursement Request (CDR) created in online CDR system:&nbsp;<a href="http://intranet/team/CS/CDR/Pages/home.aspx">http://intranet/team/CS/CDR/Pages/home.aspx</a></p>

<p>S01 refers to Step 1 while more investigation is required to document how Disbursement figures are determined and agreed with Country and Secretariat.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>Inferred to be Step 3 (S03) (&#39;Head of Country Team&#39;, which is ambiguous as a Country Head is a Senior Country Manager (SCM; S2) and a Head of multiple Countries is a Regional Head). <p>Confirmed with Dita Mocova that Step 8 has been collapsed into Step 7, resulting in an overall time savings of 1 day, as the original 2-day time commitment the Senior Finance Maager has been expanded to 3 days as more investigation is required, rather than two roles with two days apiece.</p>

Title: HSS
ProcessItemDescription:
Health Systems Strengthening SupportandCivil Society Organisations Support
WHO defines six building blocks that contribute to a strengthened health system:Health service delivery:a network of integrated and people-centred health facilities to provide access to primary and secondary care;Health workers, in the right place, at the right time with training, experience and incentives;Logistics and supply systems,including an adequate cold chain in place to deliver vaccines;Health financingto raise sufficient funds for health and improve financial risk protection;Health information and monitoringto generate quality data and to measure what is being done and achieved;Leadership and governanceto ensure that a strategic policy framework exists and there is proper accountability and oversight.

Title: Discuss and agree timing, scope and approach and team for JA
Joint Appraisal
ProcessItemDescription:
The joint appraisal is a key step in Gavis grant renewal process. It is an annual, in-country, multistakeholder review of the implementation progress and performance of Gavis vaccine and cash grant support to the country, and of its contribution to improved immunisation outcomes. While some of the analysis required for this appraisal may be available from recent reviews of the immunisation programme, it should not be viewed as a review of the national immunisation programme.
The objectives of a Joint Appraisal are:To identify persistent challenges impeding progress, in particular toward improvedcoverage and equity.To highlight areas where greater national investments and efforts, as well astechnical support, are needed.To inform the Gavisdecision on the renewal of its grants, and enable considerationof how to optimize its catalytic support to help improve immunization outcomes.
More information is available in theJoint Appraisal Guidelines.

Title: Update DOVE model data
ProcessItemDescription:
The Decade of Vaccines Economics (DOVE)model was developed by Johns Hopkins University,whichestimates the cost and financing required of the 2011-2020 period linked to the Global Vaccine Action Plan (GVAP).The data in it is updated by the Immunisation financing and sustainabilityteam. It produces multiple pieces of data and specifically for the fiscal space analysis includes estimates of the cost of traditional vaccines (how much countries have to pay for non-Gavi vaccines).
For more information on DOVE see:http://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/ivac/projects/decade-of-vaccine-economics.html
For more information on GVAP see:http://www.who.int/immunization/global_vaccine_action_plan/en/

Title: Strategic Demand Forecast
ProcessItemDescription:
The strategic demand forecast (SDF) has three primary uses:(i) to inform GAVIs long-term view of required volumes (including buffer and wastage) for GAVI73 and non-GAVI LMICs included in the Decade of Vaccines; (ii) to inform GAVIs impact projections (iii) and, as the basis for calculating financial requirements for GAVI countries through the Adjusted Demand Forecast (ADF).
The SDF is generated by the GAVI Secretariat demand forecasting team twice per year for a time horizon of 3[1] to 20 years into the future.
Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for current processes can be found here and will be updated when the future processes have been determined:W:\Policy and Performance\Policy & Market Shaping\03_Market Shaping\03_Demand Forecast\SOPs
[1] This horizon may be revised pending the finalization of the GAVI-UNICEF operational forecast.

Other source of data is the WHO quarterly call with the regions.</p>
" spParentIDs="1936" spRelatedOutputID="" spID="2136" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33803" href="" spResponsible="523" id="11"><mxCell style="input" parent="7" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="70" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Input><Activity label="Review Draft SDF" spDescription="<p>Review&nbsp;the figures and PPTs that the Market Shaping team&nbsp;produce with the data on introductions dates, demand and children reached.</p>

" spResponsible="523" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="2147" spParentIDs="1936" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="35"><mxCell style="activity" parent="7" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="680" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity><Role label="Market shaping" href="" spDescription="" spDuration="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spParentIDs="1936" spParentGuid="" spID="835" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33805" spResponsible="" id="6"><mxCell style="swimlane" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry y="400" width="1330" height="430" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Role><Activity label="Create Strategic Demand Forecast" spDescription="" spResponsible="835" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="2144" spParentIDs="1936" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="29"><mxCell style="activity" parent="6" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="320" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity><Activity label="Prepare projection of inputs" spDescription="<p>Projections of coverage are made by following the rules below:</p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:867px">
 <tbody>
  <tr>
   <td style="height:19px; width:195px">&nbsp;</td>
   <td style="height:19px; width:672px">
   <p><strong>Data sources</strong></p>
   </td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
   <td style="height:19px; width:195px">
   <p><strong>Coverage projection assumptions</strong></p>
   </td>
   <td style="height:19px; width:672px">
   <ul>
    <li>Historical coverage is obtained from 2014 WUENIC estimates as of July 2015; Indian state estimates are from CES, DLHS, and NFHS surveys</li>
    <li>Projected coverage based on standard Gavi SDF coverage projection rules:
    <ul>
     <li>If 2014 coverage is &le; 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at 90%</li>
     <li>If 2014 coverage is &gt; 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at highest historical coverage</li>
    </ul>
    </li>
   </ul>

   <p>To adjust for anomalies in routine immunization coverage patterns, exceptions to the standard coverage projection rule were made if the following occurred:</p>

   <ul>
    <li>First, WUENIC estimates have a one-time, year-on-year negative change of &ge; 10 percentage points.&nbsp;</li>
    <li>Second, Gavi Country Programmes was consulted and agreed that the change was an anomaly and that the country is expected to increase coverage at a rate greater than 1 percentage point per year.&nbsp;</li>
    <li>Last, during the year in which the decrease in coverage occurred, the country faced one of these extraordinary situations:&nbsp;&nbsp; supply issues (e.g., stock-outs), Adverse Events Following Immunisation (AEFI) related suspensions of routine immunization, and experienced conflicts or other natural / humanitarian crises.&nbsp;</li>
   </ul>

   <p>These exceptions made are to suspend the standard coverage projection rule for the first year of projections (in this case 2015) and to reset that projection based on the historic coverage in the country.&nbsp; The standard coverage projection rule is then applied to all subsequent years. No exceptions to projected coverage were made if WUENIC revised historical coverage estimates due to the inclusion of new survey information</p>

   <ul>
    <li><strong>For Ebola-affected countries</strong>: dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC average&nbsp;</li>
    <li><strong>Cote d&rsquo;Ivoire and South Sudan: </strong>internal conflict, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC average&nbsp;</li>
    <li><strong>Haiti: </strong>supply chain issues, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2011-2013 WUENIC average&nbsp;</li>
   </ul>
   </td>
  </tr>
 </tbody>
</table>

GNI per capita (GNIPC) is GNI divided by mid-year population. GNI per capita in US dollars is converted using the World Bank Atlas method which smoothes exchange rate fluctuations by using a three year moving average, price-adjusted conversion factor.</p>

Title: Prepare forecasts
ProcessItemDescription:
There will be three official external financial forecasts issued in 2016:
1.Version 12Fb  February 2016To be presented to the 26 February AFC and 18 March EC meetings (Only being prepared to support a modest (~US$40m) programme funding request)ExpenditureFocus on the period thru to 2020No change in underlying assumptions to version 12Fa issued in December 2015A new funding request (for new routine NVS programmes that were reviewed by the IRC in November 2015) will however be moved from Balance of Demand to New RequestTo support the programme funding request a cash flow forecast with a time horizon of 2016-2021 will be required per the Programme Funding Policy. For calculating 2021, we should look back at the doses from the version 12 of the ADF dose file to see how doses change in 2021 vs 2020 and then make a high level adjustment to the 2020 number we had forecasted in version 12Fa to arrive at an estimate 2021 value. (We probably cannot simply take 2020 number for 2021 given the impact of graduation). Cash inflowsNo change to forecast presented in version 12Fb
2.Version 12Fc  May 2016To be presented to the 4 May AFC and 22-23 June Board meetingsExpenditureFocus on the period thru to 2020No change in underlying assumptions to version 12Fa issued in December 2015 with the following exceptions:India and Measles strategy expenditures to be fully incorporated in the forecast2015 actuals will be incorporated and, if appropriate, changes will be made to 2016 numbersAny material changesA new funding request (covering minimally malaria and meningitis stockpile continuation) will be included. Depending on whether the new funding request was already forecasted or not, will drive whether this in incremental expenditure or notA Programme Expenditure Report for 2015 will also be included and for Q1 2016Cash inflowsUpdate for 2015 actualsUpdate 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.
3.Version 14Fa  October 2016To be presented to 21 October AFC and 7-8 December Board meetingsExpenditureFocus on the period thru to 2025Full update based off the new v14 operational forecast. Forecast will be prepared for the period thru to 2030 although we will only present thru to 2025.Forecast will include range (criteria to be defined) as well as a point forecast for the purpose of programme funding decision approvalEarly input from Seth and Anuradha to agree on handling of strategic drivers of the forecast numbersCash flowsFull update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.
In addition to the above official forecasts, version 13Fa forecast will be produced for internal purposes to test the forecasting methodology that builds off the operational forecast. We will use version 13 also to think thru what we mean by ranges etc. We will NOT share version 13 externally.

<mxGraphModel><root><Graph label="Graph" href="http://www.mxgraph.com/" PMTversion="20150826_v1.1" id="0"><mxCell/></Graph><Layer label="Default Layer" spId="" spGuid="" spID="1933" id="1"><mxCell parent="0"/></Layer><Activity label="Financial Forecast" spDescription="" spResponsible="" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="1937" spParentIDs="1933" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="7"><mxCell style="activity" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="360" y="10" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity><Activity label="Adjusted demand forecast" spDescription="" spResponsible="" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="2130" spParentIDs="1933" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="10"><mxCell style="activity" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="260" y="10" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity><Activity label="Strategic Demand Forecast" spDescription="<p>The strategic demand forecast (SDF) has three primary uses:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) to inform GAVI&rsquo;s long-term view of required volumes (including buffer and wastage) for GAVI73 and non-GAVI LMICs included in the Decade of Vaccines; (ii) to inform GAVI&rsquo;s impact projections (iii) and, as the basis for calculating financial requirements for GAVI countries through the Adjusted Demand Forecast (ADF).</p>

<p>The SDF is generated by the GAVI Secretariat demand forecasting team twice per year for a time horizon of 3<a href="#_ftn1" name="_ftnref1">[1]</a> to 20 years into the future.</p>

<p>Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for current processes can be found here and will be updated when the future processes have been determined:&nbsp;W:\Policy and Performance\Policy &amp; Market Shaping\03_Market Shaping\03_Demand Forecast\SOPs</p>

<hr />
<p><a href="#_ftnref1" name="_ftn1">[1]</a> This horizon may be revised pending the finalization of the GAVI-UNICEF operational forecast.</p>

Title: Donate funds to Gavi

Funds raised from donations made to Gavi from public and private sector donors, typically as part of the five year replenishment cycle.
(Formerly 'Raise')

id="9"><mxCell style="output" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="740" y="40" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Output><Connector href="" label="" id="10"><mxCell parent="1" source="7" target="9" edge="1"><mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Connector><Activity label="Prepare forecasts" spDescription="<p>There will be three official external financial forecasts issued in 2016:</p>

<p><strong>1.</strong><strong>Version 12Fb &ndash; February 2016</strong></p>

<ul style="list-style-type:circle">
	<li>To be presented to the 26 February AFC and 18 March EC meetings <em>(Only being prepared to support a modest (~US$40m) programme funding request)</em></li>
	<li>Expenditure
	<ul>
		<li>Focus on the period thru to 2020</li>
		<li>No change in underlying assumptions to version <strong>12Fa</strong> issued in December 2015</li>
		<li>A new funding request (for new routine NVS programmes that were reviewed by the IRC in November 2015) will however be moved from &ldquo;Balance of Demand&rdquo; to &ldquo;New Request&rdquo;</li>
		<li>To support the &ldquo;programme funding request&rdquo; a cash flow forecast with a time horizon of 2016-2021 will be required per the Programme Funding Policy. For calculating 2021, we should look back at the doses from the version 12 of the ADF dose file to see how doses change in 2021 vs 2020 and then make a high level adjustment to the 2020 number we had forecasted in version 12Fa to arrive at an estimate 2021 value. (We probably cannot simply take 2020 number for 2021 given the impact of graduation). &nbsp;</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Cash inflows
	<ul>
		<li>No change to forecast presented in version 12Fb</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>2.</strong><strong>Version 12Fc &ndash; May 2016</strong></p>

<ul style="list-style-type:circle">
	<li>To be presented to the 4 May AFC and 22-23 June Board meetings</li>
	<li>Expenditure
	<ul>
		<li>Focus on the period thru to 2020</li>
		<li>No change in underlying assumptions to version <strong>12Fa</strong> issued in December 2015 with the following exceptions:
		<ul>
			<li>India and Measles strategy expenditures to be fully incorporated in the forecast</li>
			<li>2015 actuals will be incorporated and, if appropriate, changes will be made to 2016 numbers</li>
			<li>Any material changes</li>
		</ul>
		</li>
		<li>A new funding request (covering minimally malaria and meningitis stockpile continuation) will be included. Depending on whether the new funding request was already forecasted or not, will drive whether this in incremental expenditure or not</li>
		<li>A Programme Expenditure Report for 2015 will also be included and for Q1 2016</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Cash inflows
	<ul>
		<li>Update for 2015 actuals</li>
		<li>Update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>3.</strong><strong>Version 14Fa &ndash; October 2016</strong></p>

<ul style="list-style-type:circle">
	<li>To be presented to 21 October AFC and 7-8 December Board meetings</li>
	<li>Expenditure
	<ul>
		<li>Focus on the period thru to 2025</li>
		<li>Full update based off the &ldquo;new&rdquo; v14 &ldquo;operational forecast&rdquo;. Forecast will be prepared for the period thru to 2030 although we will only present thru to 2025.</li>
		<li>Forecast will include &ldquo;range&rdquo; (criteria to be defined) as well as a &ldquo;point&rdquo; forecast for the purpose of programme funding decision approval</li>
		<li>Early input from Seth and Anuradha to agree on handling of strategic drivers of the forecast numbers</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Cash flows
	<ul>
		<li>Full&nbsp; update 2016-2020 for latest FX rates and new information on donor contributions etc.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p>In addition to the above &ldquo;official&rdquo; forecasts, <strong>version 13Fa forecast will be produced for internal purposes to test the forecasting methodology that builds off the operational forecast</strong>. We will use version 13 also to think thru what we mean by ranges etc. We will NOT share version 13 externally.</p>

Title: Prepare General Guidelines for Expressions of Interest for Gavi Support

Vaccine donation policy
Vaccine introduction grants and operational support for campaigns policy
Access to information policy
Conflict of interest and ethics policies
Document retention policy
Evaluation policy
Value statements
GAVI Alliance child protection statement
GAVI Alliance environmental statement

Title: Prepare projection of inputs
ProcessItemDescription:
Projections of coverage are made by following the rules below:
Data sources
Coverage projection assumptionsHistorical coverage is obtained from 2014 WUENIC estimates as of July 2015; Indian state estimates are from CES, DLHS, and NFHS surveysProjected coverage based on standard Gavi SDF coverage projection rules:If 2014 coverage is ? 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at 90%If 2014 coverage is > 90%, 1 percentage point increase per year capped at highest historical coverage
To adjust for anomalies in routine immunization coverage patterns, exceptions to the standard coverage projection rule were made if the following occurred:First, WUENIC estimates have a one-time, year-on-year negative change of ? 10 percentage points.Second, Gavi Country Programmes was consulted and agreed that the change was an anomaly and that the country is expected to increase coverage at a rate greater than 1 percentage point per year.Last, during the year in which the decrease in coverage occurred, the country faced one of these extraordinary situations: supply issues (e.g., stock-outs), Adverse Events Following Immunisation (AEFI) related suspensions of routine immunization, and experienced conflicts or other natural / humanitarian crises.
These exceptions made are to suspend the standard coverage projection rule for the first year of projections (in this case 2015) and to reset that projection based on the historic coverage in the country. The standard coverage projection rule is then applied to all subsequent years. No exceptions to projected coverage were made if WUENIC revised historical coverage estimates due to the inclusion of new survey informationFor Ebola-affected countries: dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC averageCote dIvoire and South Sudan: internal conflict, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2012-2014 WUENIC averageHaiti: supply chain issues, dose and impact coverages were revised using 2011-2013 WUENIC average

Title: Tweak price forecast files as requested
Circulate Internal Price Forecast and Public Price Forecast
ProcessItemDescription:
Internal Price Forecast is circulated to Market Shaping, Finance, Vaccine Implementation, Financial Sustainability & Graduation, and the CEO.
The Public Price Forecast is sent to the Country Portal, included in guidelines and by the Financial Sustainability & Graduation team.

GraphXML:
<mxGraphModel><root><Graph label="Graph" href="http://www.mxgraph.com/" id="0"><mxCell/></Graph><Layer label="Default Layer" spId="" spGuid="" spID="1384" id="1"><mxCell parent="0"/></Layer><Activity label="Joint Appraisal" spDescription="<p>The joint appraisal is a key step in Gavi&rsquo;s grant renewal process. It is an annual, in-country, multistakeholder review of the implementation progress and performance of Gavi&rsquo;s vaccine and cash grant support to the country, and of its contribution to improved immunisation outcomes. While some of the analysis required for this appraisal may be available from recent reviews of the immunisation programme, it should not be viewed as a review of the national immunisation programme.</p>

<p>The objectives of a Joint Appraisal are:</p>

<ul>
 <li>To identify persistent challenges impeding progress, in particular toward improved&nbsp;coverage and equity.</li>
 <li>To highlight areas where greater national investments and efforts, as well as&nbsp;technical support, are needed.</li>
 <li>To inform the Gavi&rsquo;sdecision on the renewal of its grants, and enable consideration&nbsp;of how to optimize its catalytic support to help improve immunization outcomes.</li>
</ul>

<p>More information is available in the&nbsp;<a href="http://intranet/team/gamr/Working_Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?RootFolder=/team/gamr/Working_Documents/Working%20Groups/Appraisals/Appraisal%20report%20template%20and%20guidance/Final%20joint%20appraisal%20documents%20-%20March%202015&amp;FolderCTID=0x012000396431BBDA20DD4EAAB3085F0EDFADC5">Joint Appraisal Guidelines</a>.</p>
" spResponsible="" spAccountable="" spSupport="" spConsulted="" spInformed="" spCompetencies="" spDuration="" spPersonDays="" spPolicies="" spKPIs="" spSupportingTechnology="" spStatus="" spID="1397" spParentIDs="1384" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33802" spRecommendations="" spComments="" href="" id="2"><mxCell style="activity" parent="1" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="160" y="30" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Activity></root></mxGraphModel>

Title: Enter payment into online banking system (S10)
ProcessItemDescription: Understood as the Step 10 (S10). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Confirm payment made (S12)
ProcessItemDescription:
Inform the Programme Officer and Senior Country Manager of the completion of the wire transfer including the amount paid and the value date.
Referred to as Step 12 (S12). However, further information to be captured as per fields below (Supporting Technology, KPIs, etc).
CDR tool presents S12 as being owned by the Programme Officer while the process map outlines Finance. Correction to be made with Finance and Business confirmation.

Title: Release payment in banking system (S11)
ProcessItemDescription: Understood as the Step 11 (S11). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S07)
ProcessItemDescription:
Confirm that there is a corresponding budget approved for this payment. Attach relevant supporting documents.Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Confirmed with Dita Mocova that Step 8 has been collapsed into Step 7, resulting in an overall time savings of 1 day, as the original 2-day time commitment the Senior Finance Maager has been expanded to 3 days as more investigation is required, rather than two roles with two days apiece.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S02)
ProcessItemDescription:
Review the CDR and confirm that all pre-requisite conditions for this payment have been satisfied, and the payment is in accordance with Gavi'slegal commitments with the beneficiary. Based on the reviewReject;Ask for clarifications; orApprove
Please note: Country Responsible Officer (CRO) is a term long replaced by Senior Country Manager (SCM). Please replace any and all instance of CRO with SCM.
Understood as Step2 (S2). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Create and prepare CDR (S01)
ProcessItemDescription:
Provided that there are no unresolved financial management issues or co-financing problems and that the country has a valid PFA (Partnership Framework Agreement).
Cash Disbursement Request (CDR) created in online CDR system:http://intranet/team/CS/CDR/Pages/home.aspx
S01 refers to Step 1 while more investigation is required to document how Disbursement figures are determined and agreed with Country and Secretariat.

Title: Recruit a consultant
ProcessItemDescription:
Request to hire a consultant  over four months Actors  4Decision Points  6Approvals  4
Request to hire a consultant  under four months Actors  2Decision Points  2Approvals  1
Procurement Process:Actors: 14Decision Points 19Approvals: 15

Title: Product Switch Operational Process - Request made by country
ProcessItemDescription: A product switchiswhen acountrychangesfrom the currentvaccine product to a newvaccineproduct.A country can request a product switch for anyGavi-supported vaccine at any time.Changing a product has various implications on programme implementation at the country level, as well asGavisfinancing requirements, policies, processes, and supply / demand management.

Title: Conduct pre and post monitoring activities of the switch
Create price forecast files for sharing with stakeholders
Create price forecast and assess changes from previous version
Identify drivers of price and model scenarios
Review and approve CDR (S06)
ProcessItemDescription:
AS-CPG is not defined. Open action to clarify 'Who'? Best practice not maintained as acronym not defined.
Confirm that all relevant documents to support this payment are attached.Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Inferred to be Step 6 (S06) as preceding step is S05 and following step is Step 06b. However, Accounting Specialist and Controller have been used interchangeable and, therefore, require Finance validation. Also, business rules informing review and approval constraints remain outstanding.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S03)
ProcessItemDescription:
Reviewtherequest and the supporting documentation. Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Inferred to be Step 3 (S03) ('Head of Country Team', which is ambiguous as a Country Head is a Senior Country Manager (SCM; S2) and a Head of multiple Countries is a Regional Head). To be confirmed and more investigation required on what informs a Regional Head's decision-making parameters.

Title: Quality assurance check of CDR (S05)
ProcessItemDescription:
Reviewtherequest and the supporting documentation. Confirm all relevant documentation is attached and the request is valid. Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Step 5 referred to as S05. However, further investigation required to clarify what inputs inform IM&QA's quality assurance check.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S09)
ProcessItemDescription:
Can be performed by Managing Director or Senior Director of Finance.
Approve the payment.Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orApprove thepayment.
Understood as Step9 (9). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S08)
ProcessItemDescription:
Review the request and supporting documents. Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Understood as Step8 (S8). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S06b)
ProcessItemDescription:
Confirm that the bank account number exists and is correct.Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Understood as Step6b (S6b). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Review and approve CDR (S04)
ProcessItemDescription:
Reviewtherequest and the supporting documentation. Based on thereview:Reject;Ask for clarifications; orRecommend thepayment.
Understood as Step4 (S4). However, no background captured on what decision inputs / business rules are used in this step. More business input required.

Title: Add further content to Cover Note
Request for a resource
ProcessItemDescription:
Currently, staff on payroll and interns as well as tempvia agency hires.
Request to hire a consultant  over four months Actors  8Decision Points  7Approvals  3 (DCEO or HRD approval is required so have not counted twice)
Request to hire a consultant  under four months Actors  2Decision Points  1Approvals  1 (Hiring manager must have approval of ET member prior to entering request)
Request to hire a consultant  through an entity Actors  2Decision Points  1Approvals  1 (Hiring manager must have approval of ET member prior to entering request)

Re-format each report in a readable format for Ernst &amp; Young.</p>
" spParentIDs="1875" spRelatedOutputID="" spID="1883" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33803" href="" spResponsible="1072" id="17"><mxCell style="activity" parent="4" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="460" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Input><Input label="Track documentation for audit purposes" spDescription="<p>There is a payroll binder for each month with proof and supporting documentation of each change requested as well as the entry made in&nbsp;<a href="https://sts.adfs.gavi.org/adfs/ls/wia">me@gavi</a>.</p>
" spParentIDs="1875" spRelatedOutputID="" spID="1882" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33803" href="" spResponsible="1072" id="14"><mxCell style="activity" parent="4" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="260" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Input><Input label="Run payflow reports" spDescription="<p>Seven reports are generated from payflow services section of&nbsp;<a href="https://sts.adfs.gavi.org/adfs/ls/wia">me@gavi</a>:</p>

<ul>
 <li>New hires</li>
 <li>Leavers</li>
 <li>Salary and employee changes</li>
 <li>Recurring elements</li>
 <li>Leave of Absence (LOA) non-paid</li>
 <li>Leave of Absence (LOA) report</li>
 <li>Employee list</li>
</ul>
" spParentIDs="1875" spRelatedOutputID="" spID="1881" spContentTypeID="0x0100B780648F0DD4474886F4D0C3F275B33803" href="" spResponsible="1072" id="12"><mxCell style="activity" parent="4" vertex="1"><mxGeometry x="360" y="20" width="80" height="60" as="geometry"/></mxCell></Input><Input label="Update me@gavi with staff changes" spDescription="<p>In <a href="https://sts.adfs.gavi.org/adfs/ls/wia">me@gavi</a>&nbsp;update information throughout the month such as new hires, leavers, promotions, salary changes i.e. FTE change, sick leave, maternity leave, no-paid leave, acting allowances, benefit changes, education grants.</p>

<p>Payroll cut-off date for each month is agreed by HR and Ernst &amp; Young and Finance on the approval and pay dates. &nbsp;After the cut-off date for the month, any further payments will be processed in the following month.</p>

Title: Prepare payslips and pension journal
ProcessItemDescription:
Send payslips by mail to HR Admin.
Send pension journal to Zurich International.

Title: Release DTA
ProcessItemDescription: Advise treasury to release the payment and copies HR Admin, HR Director, Finance Controller and Ernst & Young.

Title: Process payment
ProcessItemDescription: Post payslips to Gavi HR Admin.

Title: Send first set of reports to Ernst & Young
ProcessItemDescription: Email reports to People Advisory Services Senior Manager.

Title: Update journal and send to Zurich International
ProcessItemDescription: Remove any leavers from previous and current month to withold that month's pension payment as it will be paid in their final surrender.

Title: Provide payslips to all Geneva staff
Email Snr. Director Finance
ProcessItemDescription: Email Snr. Director Finance, with cc to Finance Controller and HR Director to release the DTA.

Title: Send notification of approval to Ernst & Young
ProcessItemDescription: Advises to release the data transfer authorisation (DTA).

Title: Send DTA
ProcessItemDescription: Send to HR Admin with copy to HR Director, Finance Controller, and Snr. Director Finance.

Title: Sign off on payroll
ProcessItemDescription:
Initial all seven reports, confirm the number of payslips expected that month and sign-off on total amount for the salaries to be paid for the month.
Initialed documents are saved in the payroll binder. The signed approved payroll salary comparative report is scanned and saved by the HR Admin in the confidential payroll folder. The scanned copy of the report is sent to Ernst & Young by HR Admin.

Title: Sign off on payroll
ProcessItemDescription:
Initial all seven reports, confirm the number of payslips expected that month and sign-off on total amount for the salaries to be paid for the month.
Initialed documents are saved in the payroll binder. The signed approved payroll salary comparative report is scanned and saved by the HR Admin in the confidential payroll folder. The scanned copy of the report is sent to Ernst & Young by HR Admin.

Title: Approve payroll
ProcessItemDescription:
Meeting of Finance Controller, HR Director and HR Admin.
Review all seven payflow reports, asking for details and confirmation if necessary.
HR Admin provides supporting documentation.
Review comparative report for all staff with changes from previousmonth. Flag if there are any issues.

Title: Approve payroll
ProcessItemDescription:
Meeting of Finance Controller, HR Director and HR Admin.
Review all seven payflow reports, asking for details and confirmation if necessary.
HR Admin provides supporting documentation.
Review comparative report for all staff with changes from previousmonth. Flag if there are any issues.

Title: Prepare payroll binder/files for approval
ProcessItemDescription: Print all payslips, add supporting documents to applicable staff payslips, including proof of calculations done if applicable. Print all seven payroll reports and the comparative journal.

Title: Update payslips and calculations report if necessary
ProcessItemDescription: Update payslips, calculations report and comparative report and send back to Gavi HR Admin.

Title: Audit payslips
ProcessItemDescription: Audit payslips for staff with changes. Compare the payslip against the reports to ensure correct data. Audit allcalculations against the calculations overview provided by Ernst & Young to ensure they are all correct.

Title: Perform all calculations
ProcessItemDescription:
Calculations related to pro-rated salaries i.e. a new hire start date after the first of the month, a leaver before the end of the month, pro-rated benefits or allowances starting after the first of the month, vacation payouts for leavers and sick leave calculations.
Included in the report the formulas used for each calculation.

Title: Prepare Approval Request and submit to Finance
PDF and circulate Record of Proceedings
Sign off on final Record of Proceedings
Send final Record of Proceedings to Chair, HLRP
Send Record of Proceedings to HLRP for review
Write Record of Proceedings of HLRP meeting
Prepare Pre-October HLRP Information Letter
ProcessItemDescription: Given Unicef Supply Division procurement requirements, all vaccine columes are to be finalised by 30 September in order to meet following-year stock requirements. Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).

Title: Send Information Letter to country explaining CRP decision and DL will follow
Clear non-standard Decision Letter
ProcessItemDescription:
Standard vanilla decision letters no longer need to be reviewed by the legal team. However, legal would continue to review non-standard decision letters, such as where the templates are not followed or non-standard language or extra conditions are introduced. Legal would also continue to review decision letter templates.
Legal clears non-standard decision letter(and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Finance. Legalprovides Financewith the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

Title: Review Decision Letter & Management Letter. Print Letters.
Clear Decision Letter
ProcessItemDescription: FIN clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to PO informing that they havecleared the DL, and it is now ready for finalisation and sending out. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

Title: Clear Decision Letter
ProcessItemDescription: The first team (VI / HSS / FS&G) clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Legal to clear. The first team provides the next with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

Title: Clear Decision Letter
ProcessItemDescription: The first team (VI / HSS / FS&G) clears the DL (and initials/dates the Sharepoint tracking sheet) and sends an email to the next team, copying the relevant PO, informing that they have cleared the DL, and it is now ready for Legal to clear. The first team provides the next with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

Title: Clear Decision Letter

The first team provides the next with the file location. The Decision Letter is not emailed.

Send PDF files to country counterparts and copy partners, legal
ProcessItemDescription: The Decision Letter .pdfs are now sent to the country counterparts (EPI manager etc.), with email copies to all relevant partners and Legal(all CCs are listed on the cover letter and in the tracking document) Any revisions/updates to DLs need to be annotated and filed with the original DL.

Title: Scan and save Decision & Management Letters
ProcessItemDescription: The signed Decision and Management Letters are scanned and saved as PDF documents in the relevant SharePoint location (xxx) with nomenclature to enable easy identification and retrieval.

Title: Inform teams Decision Letter is ready for clearance and track responses
ProcessItemDescription: Each stakeholder within the Secretariat now clears each decision letter, sequentially as follows: VI/HSS/FS&G, Legal, Finance. The PO is responsible for tracking the clearance of each DL with each team, ensuring that the DLs are cleared by each team within 2 working days with any team. Tracking sheet:http://intranet/team/CS/Decision%20Letters/Forms/AllItems.aspx

Title: Christie is working on lots of processes and so it requires lots of text.
Design process (including scope)
ProcessItemDescription:
Who is the point of contact for designing process(es)? Are processes the responsibility of the Policy (and Performance) department? If so, I would recommend that we review all As Is and To Be processes with thecorresponding Policy author(s) / owner(s). This would help us clarify Process ownership as well, which is a key 'layer' in the Process Maturity framework.
I would recommend that we baseline all 'live' Policies and frame them against the existing Processes to identify gaps and a process map roadmap and prioritisation list.
KPIs: Number of Approved 'Out of policy' Grants, Number of Disbursed 'Out of policy' Grants
Policies: Input to come from the Policy & Performance team

ProcessItemDescription: Using MobileXpense

ProcessItemDescription: With support from Joint Appraisal Team.

Title: Propose and agree issues to be addressed during JA
Collate data to inform JA discussions
ProcessItemDescription: Take into consideration reviews that have already taken place in the country, past experiences of what has worked well or issues, data that is available and future plans.

Title: Discuss and agree timing, scope and approach and team for JA
ProcessItemDescription:
Involve country, Unicef, WHO and any other partners, as well as the Senior Country Manager. This group then becomes the Joint Appraisal (JA) team.
UseJoint Appraisal Guidelines.

Discuss and agree timing, scope and approach and team for JA

ProcessItemDescription: Process should take place in line with High Level Review Panel (HLRP).If possible, the decision letter should be revised according to HLRP timelines to avoid additional work. If the request is out of sync with HLRP, then the SCM should initiate a revision of the current DL to reflect the new product being used.

Title: Share approved letter with relevant internal and external parties
Inform country with information letter and request plans for implementation
Discuss request and identify any programmatic implications
Review request
ProcessItemDescription: Depending on the type of request, you may want to involve Market Shaping.

Title: Review request
ProcessItemDescription: Depending on the type of request, you may want to involve the Legal Department.

Draft letter to the country with recommendations for approval by Managing Director, Country Programmes
Convene internal meeting. Discuss request and provide recommendations
ProcessItemDescription: As each product switch request will be unique, it is at the discrection of the SCM and PM whether to convene an internal meeting. In some cases, it may be sufficient to discuss the issues via email and obtain email approval.

Title: Receive confirmation of funds transfer and attach to CDR
Provide clarifications

Notify applicant of any revision recommendations

ProcessItemDescription: Programme Officer and Senior Country Manager communicates with Country.

Receive link via Me@Gavi to exit interview with instructions

Ongoing dialogue with country and partners

Update form once items are returned, enter date completed and click submit
Update form once items are returned, enter date completed and click submit

Respond to HRBP email with all requested details and completed paperwork
Confirm contract end date with manager
Confirm approval of leave days with manager - confirm both last working date and contract end date
Send non-international local benefits email template with outlined attachments to staff and schedule one hour exit interview
Send international benefits email template with outlined attachments to staff and schedule one hour exit interview
Send Joint Appraisal Report to A&R

Release the payment in the banking system

Title: Senior Executive Officer, CP
ProcessItemDescription: Senior Executive Officer, County Programmes

Title: TBC: Clarification required
ProcessItemDescription:
Given that Comments (formerly referred to as 'Clarifications') are not captred in the HLRP forum it is not clear how this process step or decision relates to the current HLRP process.
In addition, given that HLRP 'Strenghening Actions' are not captured at a Country-level, it is not clear what an SCM would action or clarify with a Country.

Title: Grant financing required?
ProcessItemDescription: This process requires a greater understanding of the Country Journey that leads them to Gavi, including their Governmental fiscal planning, health policies and fiscal planning, available human and financial resources, such that our channels, policies, guidelines, and communications better suit their needs from the perspective of content, context, and timeliness.

Title: Country validation
ProcessItemDescription: Country has 15 days to comment. If the country does not respond within this timeframe, the proposition is seen as accepted by the country.

Title: Renew or transition

Title: Approve New version SDF
ProcessItemDescription: Strategic Demand Forecast (SDF)

Title: Approve price forecast
ProcessItemDescription: A meeting with the Head of Market Shaping and Director of Policy & Market Shaping takes place to approve the price forecast. If minor modifications are required, this will be made by the Senior Manager, Price Forecast and included in the price forecast files. If major updates are required this will be made by the Senior Manager, Price Forecast and then presented again to the Head of Market Shaping and Director of Policy & Market Shaping.

Title: Approve Financial Forecast and Programme Funding Request
Recommend approval of Financial Forecast and Programme Funding Request
Provisional approval of Financial Forecast
ProcessItemDescription: Approve Financial Forecast during Expenditure Review Panel

Title: Sign off on EPCs and Op Forecast
Provisional approval of amounts in Operational Forecast
ProcessItemDescription: During Endorsed Programme Costs (EPC) Review Meeting

Title: Approve and sign off Op. Forecast
Scenario choice and finalisation
ProcessItemDescription: Consultation between IMQA, Vaccine Programme Manager and Senior Country Manager.

Title: Dosage demand review meeting
ProcessItemDescription: What are the decisions being made here?

Title: Country Partner?
ProcessItemDescription: If a country partner, requesting and receiving confirmation of receipt of a cash disbursement (i.e. a cash payment) is required. If a non-country partner, PO is not required to confirmation receipt of cash disbursement.

Title: Agree with recommendation of SCM & VPM
Agree with recommendation of SCM & VPM
Switch recommended
ProcessItemDescription: Senior Country Manager and Vaccine Programme Manager will make this recommendation jointly.

Title: Request >$2M / Region Head an SCM
ProcessItemDescription: Request > $2 million,or Head is equal to Senior Country Manager (SCM)

Title: Is the external resource through an entity?
Contract duration more than 4 months
ProcessItemDescription: Does not apply to extensions.

Title: Are there errors in the calculations or payslip
Outstanding issues?
ProcessItemDescription: For example if equipment has not been returned.

Title: Extend contract?
ProcessItemDescription: 3-4 weeks (TBD), notification will be sent automatically from me@gavi to the Manager and Focal Point.

Title: Is the request budgeted for
ProcessItemDescription: Information is entered by the Hiring Manager at the time of making the request if the position is budgeted for or not.

Title: Is HLRP taking place in October?
Type of grant
ProcessItemDescription: Depending on the type of grant, the approval request will be approved by either the Board and Executive Committee, or the CEO.

Title: Approve exhibit
ProcessItemDescription:
If approved, email team focal point.
If not approved, go back to HRBP to review it.

Title: What type of contractor is required?
ProcessItemDescription: Temp via agency - engaged through placement agency (for example, administrative assistant)Technical support (for example, cleaner)Consultant (onsite or offsite) - engaged through consulting firm (for example IT specialists from Blue Infinity)Independent Contractor (onsite or offsite) - hired directly through their own firm (for example specialist consultants)

Title: Duration of time consultant is required for
Amendments?

DOVE model
ProcessItemDescription:
The Decade of Vaccines Economics (DOVE)model was developed by Johns Hopkins University,whichestimates the cost and financing required of the 2011-2020 period linked to the Global Vaccine Action Plan (GVAP).The data in it is updated by the Immunisation financing and sustainabilityteam. It produces multiple pieces of data and specifically for the fiscal space analysis includes estimates of the cost of traditional vaccines (how much countries have to pay for non-Gavi vaccines).
For more information on DOVE see:http://www.jhsph.edu/research/centers-and-institutes/ivac/projects/decade-of-vaccine-economics.html
For more information on GVAP see:http://www.who.int/immunization/global_vaccine_action_plan/en/

Title: Population projections
ProcessItemDescription: The 2015 Revision of World Population Prospects is the twenty-fourth round of official United Nations population estimates and projections that have been prepared by the Population Division of the Department of Economic and Social Affairs of the United Nations Secretariat. The main results are presented in a series of Excel files displaying key demographic indicators for each development group, income group, major area, region and country for selected periods or dates within 1950-2100. A publication labelled Key findings and advance tables, which provide insights on the results of this latest revision, is also made available from theWPP website.

ProcessItemDescription:

Title: GNIPC and Eligibility projections
ProcessItemDescription:
Gross national income (GNI) is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. GNI per capita (GNIPC) is GNI divided by mid-year population. GNI per capita in US dollars is converted using the World Bank Atlas method which smoothes exchange rate fluctuations by using a three year moving average, price-adjusted conversion factor.
http://www.gavi.org/about/governance/programme-policies/country-eligibility/

Title: WUENIC coverage
ProcessItemDescription:
WHO and Unicef estimates of national immunization coverage (WUENIC)is a rule-based system implemented as a logic program, developed by WHO and UNICEF for estimating global, country by country, infant immunization coverage.
http://www.who.int/immunization/monitoring_surveillance/data/en/

Title: Unicef Supply Division
ProcessItemDescription: Given Unicef Supply Division procurement requirements, all vaccine columes are to be finalised by 30 September in order to meet following-year stock requirements. Therefore, given the current HLRP timelines (May, July, October), an Information Letter outlining projected (unapproved) dollars and doses is required to be sent in September so that each Country has visibility to current Gavi understanding of upcoming grant renewal dollars and doses in advance of submitting aggregated vaccine order quantities to Unicef Supply Division (required by no later than 30 September).
